abstract: Court in Czech Republic acquits Jana Necasova, wife of former Prime Min Petr Necas, of charges that she used military intelligence agency to spy on Necas's estranged former wife; case brought down government in 2013.
lead_paragraph: A Prague court on Friday acquitted the wife of former Prime Minister Petr Necas of abuse-of-power charges in a case that brought down his government in 2013.

headline.main: Czech Republic: Wife of Ex-Premier Is Acquitted of Abusing Power
headline.print_headline: Europe; Czech Republic: Wife of Ex-Premier Is Acquitted of Abusing Power

snippet: A Prague court on Friday acquitted the wife of former Prime Minister Petr Necas of abuse-of-power charges in a case that brought down his government in 2013.
